# Separate the current Justices from those no longer on the court
# set up a field for active vs inactive status
status_df = trimmed_df
status_df['status'] = 'inactive'
status_df['status'][status_df['term_end']==''] = 'active'
#
# if there is no term_end, set the ending date to be today
status_df['term_end'][status_df['term_end']==''] = datetime.today().strftime('%Y-%m-%d')
status_df['term_end'] = status_df['term_end'].apply(lambda x: datetime.strptime(str(x)[0:10], '%Y-%m-%d'))

print(status_df.info())
print(status_df.tail(10))

# Compute ages and term length

chart_df = status_df

chart_df['birth_year'] = chart_df['birth_date'].apply(lambda x: x.year)
chart_df['start_year'] = chart_df['term_start'].apply(lambda y: y.year)
chart_df['end_year'] = chart_df['term_end'].apply(lambda z: z.year)
chart_df['start_age'] = chart_df['start_year'] - chart_df['birth_year']
chart_df['end_age']   = chart_df['end_year'] - chart_df['birth_year']
chart_df['term'] = chart_df['end_age'] - chart_df['start_age']
print(chart_df.head())
print(chart_df.tail())

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(20,20))

# current court in yellow; retired justices in blue.
colors = []
for c in chart_df['status']:
    if c == 'active':  colors.append('yellow')
    if c == 'inactive':  colors.append('blue')

# horizontal bar chart
ax.barh(chart_df.name, chart_df['term'], left=chart_df['start_age'], color=colors)

ax.set_xlim(30,100)
ax.set_ylabel('Supreme Court Justices')
ax.set_xlabel('Ages of Supreme Court Service')
ax.set_title('Ages Served by Supreme Court Justices')

# Rechart the Data
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(30,15))

# Chart the starting age as a blue line graph;
#   the ending age as a red line graph
#   the term as a yellow bar chart at the bottom.
ax.plot(chart_df.index, chart_df['start_age'], color='blue', label='start age')
ax.plot(chart_df.index, chart_df['end_age'], color='red', label='ending age')
ax.bar(chart_df.index, chart_df['term'], color='yellow', label='term length')

# add trend lines to all three data points
def trendy(x,y,c):
    z = np.polyfit(x, y, 1)
    p = np.poly1d(z)
    plt.plot(x, p(x), c)
    
trendy(chart_df.index, chart_df['start_age'], 'b--')
trendy(chart_df.index[chart_df['status']=='inactive'], chart_df['end_age'][chart_df['status']=='inactive'], 'r--')
trendy(chart_df.index[chart_df['status']=='inactive'], chart_df['term'][chart_df['status']=='inactive'], 'g--')

# set up the x-axis to show all of the justice names
ax.set_xlabel('Supreme Court Justices')
#ax.set_xlim(0)
ax.set_xticks(range(0,len(chart_df.name)))
ax.set_xticklabels(chart_df.name, rotation=90)

# set up the y-axis to show years 0 through 100
ax.set_ylim(0,100)
ax.set_ylabel('Ages (Years) Served on Supreme Court')
ax.set_yticks([0,20,40,60,80,100])

# finalize and show chart
ax.set_title('Ages Served by Supreme Court Justices', size=18)
ax.legend(fontsize=15)
plt.show()
